title: MachineAnnotationService
description: Automated annotation services that enhance biodiversity data

@id.description: The unique identifier (handle) of the Machine Annotation Service object

@type.description: The type of the object, in this case ods:MachineAnnotationService

schema:identifier.description: Handle of the Machine Annotation Service

ods:fdoType.description: The DOI to the FDO type of the object

ods:status.description: The status of the Digital Object. A digital object can be in Draft, when it is not published yet. Active when it is published and the object is active and Tombstone which means the object has been archived.

schema:version.description: The version of the object, each change generates a new version. The version starts at 1 and each change will increment the version number with 1

schema:name.description: Name of the Machine Annotation Service as provided by the user, https://schema.org/name

schema:description.description: Description of the Machine Annotation Service as provided by the user, https://schema.org/description
examples: A service that links GBIF records to a DiSSCo Digital Specimen. It creates an EntityRelationship indicating the relationship

schema:dateCreated.description: Timestamp of creation. Internally generated, following the ISO Date Time Format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

schema:dateModified.description: Timestamp of last modification. Internally generated, following the ISO Date Time Format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX

schema:creator.description: Contains information about the creator of this MachineAnnotationService Digital Object, the agent creating this record in DiSSCo's system

ods:containerImage.description: The URI to the location of the image in a public container repository. Should only contain the image name and not the tag

ods:containerTag.description: The image tag of the container image. This should not be `latest` but point to a specific version. On an update of the application a new image tag should be generated and the Digital Object should be updated

ods:hasTargetDigitalObjectFilter.description: Filters describing the criteria that a Digital Object must meet in order to apply the MAS. No filters implies the MAS may run on *any* digital object. Field names are given in JSON paths, and accepted values for that field are provided as an arrays. An `*` can be used as a wildcard, indicating any value is seen as valid

schema:creativeWorkStatus.description: The current status of the service in terms of its service lifecycle

schema:codeRepository.description: Link to the repository where the un-compiled, human readable code and related code is located (SVN, GitHub, CodePlex)

schema:programmingLanguage.description: The primary programming language used by the MAS

ods:serviceAvailability.description: Availability commitment in uptime percentage of the service provider as described in the SLA

schema:maintainer.description: Party maintaining the code, could be an schema:Organisation or a schema:Person

schema:license.description: A license document which applies to this Machine Annotation Service

schema:ContactPoint.description: The contact point for support and information for the Machine Annotation Service

schema:description.description: General description of the contact point

schema:url.description: URL of the contact point, this could be a link to a contact form or a link to a github issues page

schema:telephone.description: Telephone number of the contact point

ods:slaDocumentation.description: Link to SLA documentation of the Machine Annotation Service

ods:topicName.description: Kafka topic through which the MAS receives messages. Defaults to PID of the Machine Annotation Service

ods:maxReplicas.description: The maximum amount of this MAS that can simultaneously run without causing issues

ods:batchingPermitted.description: Whether or not this Machine Annotation Service can create Batch Annotations. Machine Annotations Service outputs must then comply with batchMetadata, see https://schemas.dissco.tech/schemas/annotations/0.1.0/annotation-event.json

ods:timeToLive.description: Time in milliseconds the MAS message may remain in the Kafka Queue before being marked as timed out. Min 1 hour.

ods:hasTombstoneMetadata.description: Object containing the tombstone metadata of the object

ods:hasEnvironmentalVariables.description: Environmental variables to supply to the Machine Annotation Service, non-sensitive

ods:hasSecretVariables.description: Secret variables to supply to the Machine Annotation Service, sensitive
